task.title: Operating Set Point and Differential Adjustment

context.p: The Operating Set Point is adjustable from 90°F (42°C) to 180°F (82°C). The factory setting is 120°F (49°C). The Differential is adjustable from 2° to 20°. The factory setting is 8°. These user settings are accessed from the Temperatures menu. The following instructions explain how to adjust these settings and navigate the control system menus.

When the water temperature, sensed by the control system from the two (upper and lower) temperature probes, reaches the Operating Set Point, the control system ends the heating cycle. A heating cycle begins again when the sensed water temperature drops below the Operating Set Point minus the Differential setting.
context.note: A lower Differential setting can cause excessive heating cycles (short-cycling), which can cause premature failure of components, such as the hot surface igniter. Set the Differential at the highest setting that produces an acceptable hot water supply. Set the Operating Set Point to the lowest setting that produces an acceptable hot water supply for most efficient use.

step.cmd: From the Desktop screen, press the multi-function button under MENU.
Use the Up and Down slidebar to view all control system menus from the Main Menu.

info.p: The Main Menu is where all control system menus are listed. See for a complete list and description of control system menus.

step.cmd: With the Temperatures menu selected (highlighted in black), in the Main Menu, press the multi-function button under SELECT to enter the Temperatures menu. If the Temperatures menu is not selected, use the Up and Down slidebar to select this menu item.

With the Operating Set Point selected, in the Temperatures menu, press the multi-function button under CHANGE to activate the adjustment mode for this menu item. If Operating Set Point is not selected, use the Up and Down slidebar to select this menu item.

info.note: Higher-temperature settings increase wear and operating costs. Set the Operating Set Point to the lowest setting that produces an acceptable hot water supply. This will always provide the most energy-efficient operation and longer life.

step.stepresult: With the adjustment mode for the Operating Set Point activated, the selection bar will change from a black fill to a black outline.

substep.cmd: Press the multifunction button under UPDATE to save the new setting.
Press the multifunction button under CANCEL to discard changes and return to the previously saved setting.

info.note: Use this procedure to change the Differential setting and other adjustable user settings in the control system menus.
